revision.text:
[[File:Badge case 2.0.png|thumb|365px]] '''Gyms''' are special areas in Pokéclicker where the player can earn gym badges and unlock new routes by defeating the gym leader in a battle. There are 8 or More gyms in each region plus the Pokémon League building, which includes the Elite 4 trainers and the champion.
==Features== ===Gym Auto-Rebattle=== Upon defeating a Gym for the 100th time the '''Gym Auto-Rebattle''' feature is unlocked. This allows gyms to be automatically restarted. However, each Gym fight using the Auto-Rebattle feature costs 2x the base cost (not including Achievement or Battle Item Bonuses) of the Gym and clearing the gym does not award any money.
==[[Kanto]]==
===Level Cap===
There are level caps that restrict the maximum level of obtained Pokémon in Kanto. The general formula is:

\colorbox{White}{$Max level = (n + 2)*10$}

where n = the number of obtained badges by the player. Below is a table of badges and the respective level cap.
{| class="wikitable collapsible collapsed" style="text-align: center;" |- ! Number of Obtained Badges !! Level Cap |- | 0 || 20 |- | 1 || 30 |- | 2 || 40 |- | 3 || 50 |- | 4 || 60 |- | 5 || 70 |- | 6 || 80 |- | 7 || 90 |- | 8 || 100 |- |}
===Gyms===
*Note: Minimum attack is calculated without taking into consideration click attack or the Pokémon's type(s). You can see how much damage you do against a certain Pokémon by clicking on or scrolling over the "Pokémon attack" number below the battle screen. The [[Type Effectiveness]] page has more information on how type matchups are ruled in Pokéclicker.
